column2: Not for nothing is the Mormont sigil a bear: I have long had vivid dreams of being some great beast of the forest hunting its prey, now a great snow bear has emerged from the woods. Strangely docile it seems to be seeking me out, almost as if it recognises me…
I am a skinchanger, and I claim the bear as my second skin!
I am no beast!

Not for nothing is the Mormont sigil a bear: I have long had vivid dreams of being some great beast of the forest hunting its prey, now a great brown bear has emerged from the woods. Strangely docile it seems to be seeking me out, almost as if it recognises me…
I am a skinchanger, and I claim the bear as my second skin!
I am no beast!

Not for nothing is the Blackwood sigil a raven: I have long had vivid dreams of flying on inky black wings. Today a large raven landed outside my window and tried to hop inside. Strangely docile it seems to be seeking me out, almost as if it recognises me…
I am a skinchanger, and I claim the raven as my second skin!
I am no beast!

I have been having vivid dreams of late, dreams of the leaf and stone, dreams of what is past and what may yet be to come. Could these dreams have meaning? My bloodline is strong with the ancient blood of the First Men, the ancient folk who communed with the children of the Forest, could these dreams be messages from the Old Gods themselves?
I embrace the Old God’s Gift!
Best not to dwell upon dreams.

You bear the blood of many a legendary hunter, and the thrill of the chase as you stalk your prey has always held an appeal for you. Do you embrace the calling of your ancestors and become a committed huntsman?
Hunting is in my blood.
Hunting bores me.
Your bloodline has long been associated with sorcery, mysticism and fell magics. Do you seek to emulate your ancestors and learn the arcane secrets?
I shall seek out the secrets of the world.
I am not some woods-witch or hedge wizard!
Some men say you have black blood, and certainly many of your ancestors have committed foul and unspeakable deeds. Of late you have become more and more tempted to follow in their footsteps.
Others deserve to know pain!
I am better than the dirt I spring from!
The Fowler sigil is a falcon, their words are "Let Me Soar" and often as you ride you think of the joys an interest in falconry could bring. Maybe it is your Fowler blood calling to you?
I must get myself a bird.
There are better uses of my time.

The Blackmont sigil is a great vulture and your legendary ancestor King Benedict Blackmont was said to have the power to transform himself into a vulture of enormous size. Now a great vulture perches before you, its eyes seeming to pierce your very soul, as if it recognises you. Are the stories true? Were the Blackmonts of old skinchangers?
Blackmont blood flows in my veins, this vulture is my second skin!
I’ll have no part of this sorcery.
King Robert Baratheon was a mighty man with prodigious appetites, and his lust was chief amongst them. Lately you have begun to wonder if you might take after him?
Why must desire be a sin?
There is virtue in restraint.
Queen Danaerys Stormborn felt that slavery was a cruel injustice to be stamped out wherever possible. You bear her blood, will you follow her example?
I must break the chains wherever I find them!
It is not my problem to solve.
Some men say you have black blood, and many of your ancestors have had reputations for being ruled by their anger. Of late you have found yourself become more and more prone to violent outburst.
Anger is in my blood.
I will think calm thoughts.
Many of your ancestors have been known for their great beauty, it seems that though not evident at your birth you take after your forebears and you have grown quite beautiful.
I have become rather comely.

Not for nothing is the Stark sigil a direwolf: you have long had vivid dreams of being some great beast of the forest stalking its prey at the head of a mighty pack, now to your amazement a direwolf has emerged from the woods. Thought extinct south of the Wall it seems strangely docile and seems to be seeking you out, almost as if it recognises you…
I am a warg, and I recognise the direwolf as my second skin!
I am no beast.

Not for nothing is the Stark sigil a direwolf: you have long had vivid dreams of being some great beast of the forest stalking its prey at the head of a mighty pack, now to your amazement a large wolf has emerged from the woods. Strangely docile it seems to be seeking you out, almost as if it recognises you…
I am a warg, and I recognise the wolf as my second skin!
I am no beast.

My ancestor Robb Stark was a skilled tactician who whilst little more than a child smashed the armies of the West and the Iron Throne, securing the independence of the North and the Trident. Lately I have been reading more and more of his exploits and am becoming intrigued by his pursuit of strategy.
Strategy is fascinating maybe I should study it more…
Interesting as this is, I have more pressing matters to attend to.

Not for nothing is the castle of the Boltons called the Dreadfort – many of my ancestors have been known for their cruel and inventive methods of torturing others: it is said that skinning their foes was just the start for men like King Robar Redarm. Should I seek to follow their example, or should I chart my own course?
Others deserve to know pain.
I am not my ancestors.

The Starks are known as an honourable and just lot – it is said the man who passes the sentence should swing the sword. As men like Cregan Stark showed justice is not always the same thing as leniency and it is a hard path to walk. Should I follow my Stark Blood or are these views antiquated and pointless?
Justice has its merits.
The need for flexibility outweighs the need for justice.

The old blood of the First Men or even the giants themselves must surely flow very strongly in your veins! It would appear that though it did not manifest itself at birth, you have a natural predisposition towards a tall and imposing stature that is now clear to see for all.
I have become rather tall.

The old blood of the First Men must surely flow very strongly in your veins! Houses with strong First Men ancestry such as the Royces, Umbers, Crakehalls, Mormonts, Durrandons, and Strongs are all known to often tend towards great strength. It would appear that though it did not manifest itself at birth, you have a natural predisposition towards a strong and robust physique!
I have become rather strong.
Many of your ancestors were legendary warriors, renowned for bravery and courage. Inspired by their example you constantly strive to prove yourself through acts of valour.
I lead from the front!
Bravery is recklessness, I am not my ancestors!
Family, Duty, Honour – these are the words of House Tully. As a bearer of the Tully bloodline many will expect you to live by these values too.
These are words to live by.
What a load of nonsense.
Your ancestors valued the bonds that made the family whole, understanding strength came from kindred. Will you be inspired by their example?
Family first!
I never much cared for my kin.
A number of your ancestors acquired reputations for piety, conviction, and religious belief. Should you follow in their example?
Become Zealous.
Too much piety can be a bad thing.

The other Ironborn call the members of House Codd craven cowards who fight in underhanded ways that would shame any true Ironborn. As I bear the blood of House Codd that reputation brings shame on me, what should I do?
I may be craven, but they will be dead.
Ironborn do not flee from a fight!

It is said that since Rose of Red Lake herself the women of House Crane have had the ability to transform themselves into a crane at will. Now a great crane perches before me, its eyes seeming to pierce my very soul, as if it recognises me. Are the stories true? Were the Cranes of old skinchangers?
Crane blood flows in my veins, this bird is my second skin!
Shoo, you pesky bird!
You bear the blood of Aerys II, the Mad King, and his obsession with fire and flame is in his blood it seems. You have become captivated by the power of fire, how it dances, how it flickers…
I shall harness flame as my servant.
Aerys was a madman.

Morgon Banefort, the last Banefort King, cursed his Lannister enemies before they put him to death. Soon after the lions of Casterly Rock broke free slaying three of Loreon Lannister’s sons. I long thought these stories a myth, but today I encountered on of the great lions of the West as I was out riding, it eyes seeming to peer into my very soul. Strangely docile it seems to be seeking me out, almost as if it recognises me…
I am a skinchanger, and I claim the lion as my second skin!
I am no beast!

Not for nothing is the Reed sigil a lizard-lion: I have long had vivid dreams of being some great beast of the marsh hunting its prey, now a lizard-lion has emerged from the swamp. Strangely docile it seems to be seeking me out, almost as if it recognises me…
The blood of the Marsh King flows in my veins!
I am no beast!

You bear the blood of the Karstarks, who have held lands just south of the Wall since Karlon Stark put down a rebel lord. The constant threat of wildling raids and the precariousness of life that far north meant that the Karstarks had to become tough and fierce, with a lifestyle that predisposed them to being strong enough to deal with everything life threw at them, as a result you have obtained a strong and robust physique that is now clear to see for all.
I have become rather strong.
You bear the blood of legendary poets and renowned bard, and music and song have always held an appeal for you. Do you embrace the calling of your ancestors and become a committed poet?
I must get myself a lute.
There are better uses of my time.
There is an old saying in Dorne: "Half of the Ullers are half-mad, and the other half are worse", and the Ullers have always tended to be a prickly and paranoid bunch.
Well everyone IS out to get me.

The topmost levels of Harrenhal are infested with nests of the black bats from which House Lothston takes its sigil, now one perches before me, it eyes seeming to peer into my very soul. Strangely docile it seems to be seeking me out, almost as if it recognises me…
Lothston blood flows in my veins, this bat is my second skin!
Shoo, you pest!

The smallfolk whisper tales of how my ancestor Danelle Lothston, the mad Lady of Harrenhal, turned to the dark arts during the reign of King Maekar, bathing in blood and presiding over feasts of human flesh. Lately you have begun to have urges… of a most peculiar nature…
Just a little taste…
No I will never be a cannibal!

The smallfolk whisper tales of how my ancestor Danelle Lothston, the mad Lady of Harrenhal, turned to the dark arts during the reign of King Maekar, sending out giant black bats from Harrenhal to steal children. Now the largest bat I have ever seen perches before me, it eyes seeming to peer into my very soul. Strangely docile it seems to be seeking me out, almost as if it recognises me…
Lothston blood flows in my veins, this bat is my second skin!
Shoo, you monster!

The topmost levels of Harrenhal are infested with nests of the black bats from which House Whent takes its sigil, now one perches before me, it eyes seeming to peer into my very soul. Strangely docile it seems to be seeking me out, almost as if it recognises me…
Whent blood flows in my veins, this bat is my second skin!
Shoo, you pest!

The topmost levels of Harrenhal are infested with nests of the black bats which are strongly associated with the castle, now one perches before me, it eyes seeming to peer into my very soul. Strangely docile it seems to be seeking me out, almost as if it recognises me…
The blood of Harrenhal flows in my veins, this bat is my second skin!
Shoo, you pest!

The topmost levels of Harrenhal are infested with nests of the black bats which are strongly associated with the castle and the black sorceries said to reside there. Now the largest bat I have ever seen perches before me, it eyes seeming to peer into my very soul. Strangely docile it seems to be seeking me out, almost as if it recognises me…
The blood of Harrenhal flows in my veins, this bat is my second skin!
Shoo, you monster!

A number of your ancestors have a reputation for succumbing to madness. It seems that their malady is in your blood as well, as you have been feeling more and more disturbed of late, seeing and hearing what is not there…
Me mad, nonsense!

A number of your ancestors have a reputation for succumbing to madness. It seems that their malady is in your blood as well, as you have been feeling more and more disturbed of late, seeing and hearing what is not there…
Me mad, nonsense!

Lately you have begun to experience violent outburst, strange hallucinations and all sorts of disturbing thoughts. Maybe the dark forces that your ancestors were said to commune with have come for you at last?
Come to me dark spirits!

I bear the blood of one who achieved what few skinchangers can and became master of many different beasts. Their magics seem to linger in my blood, granting me a trace of their gift and allowing me to bend creatures to my will. Perhaps I should use this and seek out an animal to wear as my second skin.
I shall seek out a canine.
I want to fly.
Something a little calmer perhaps.
Skinchanging does not appeal to me.

As the rebuilding of Harrenhal progresses I begin to gain a greater understanding of how to manage construction and manage workmen, but there are other things I come to understand. There are mysteries here, dark sorceries, and great danger. So long as I remain in control and do not go too far there is much I could learn.
My renown grows!

As the rebuilding of Harrenhal progresses I begin to gain a greater understanding of how to manage construction and manage workmen, but there are other things I come to understand. There are mysteries here, dark sorceries, and great danger. But what is danger to one such as I? I shall command the magics here, whatever the cost!
My infamy grows!
I have achieved what few skinchangers have ever managed to do and developed the ability to bend almost any animal to my will, wearing their skin as my own. I now bear the title of the Great Warg.
I am truly the chosen of the Gods!
I shall take a nickname to reflect my power.

I bear the blood of Bran Stark, a mighty greenseer and skinchanger, readily able to become master of any beasts he encountered. His magics seem to linger in my blood, granting me a trace of his gift and allowing me to bend creatures to my will. Perhaps I should use this and seek out an animal to wear as my second skin.
I shall seek out a powerful predator.
I want to fly.
Something a little calmer perhaps.
I want to swim through the water.

Ever since I awoke from my dream of the Three-Eyed Crow I have felt… different. My wolf dreams are more and more vivid each day, and I now realise that I am a skinchanger, a warg, like in Old Nan's tales. Summer will always be my truest second skin, but I know that my power reaches beyond just one animal. Perhaps I should use it and seek out other animals to wear as my second skin.
I shall seek out a powerful predator.
I want to fly.
Something a little calmer perhaps.
The sea calls to me.
There are many powerful beasts of the forest I might seek to control. What manner of beast would best suit me at present?
A wolf to run beside Summer in the pack.
A mighty bear.
A stealthy and powerful shadowcat.
No, I will travel further afield for the beast I seek.
Perhaps I would have more luck if I looked further afield. What manner of beast would best suit me at present?
I shall tame one of the mighty snowbears, from north of the Wall.
I shall travel to the Neck and tame a lizard-lion.
I shall tame one of the lions of the Westerlands.
On second thoughts…

When I fell, the Three-Eyed Crow told me that I would never walk again, but that I would fly. I shall dominate the skies and take a flying creature as my second skin, but what would best suit me at present?
A mighty eagle to soar high in the clouds.
A simple crow.
A bat, in honour of my Grandmother, Minisa Whent.
I shall tame an elegant crane.
There are many sorts of animal that can be found in a castle or in its environs, perhaps one of them would best suit me at present?
I shall master one of the hounds from the kennels.
I shall tame one of the cats.
There is a tough and cunning goat in the yard.
No, I will travel further afield for the beast I seek.
Perhaps I would have more luck if I looked outside the castle for a truly wild beast. What manner of creature would best suit me at present?
I shall tame a mighty boar from the woods.
I will master a majestic stag from the forest.
I will master a cunning fox from the forest.
On second thoughts…
Of late I have been dreaming more and more of the sea. Perhaps I shall find another beast there, but what manner of sea-creature should I seek to master
I shall seek out a mighty leviathon of the deep.
I shall claim a sea-lion.

After a night of heavy drinking I stumbled out into the woods to clear your head. As I walk amongst the trees I suddenly see the most beautiful woman I have ever beheld, coyly she beckons me over, indicating I should follow her.
I give her a good tumble.
I shake my head and go back inside.

The next morning I awake on a bed of moss and leaves, my head pounding, my body covered in scratches. I look over at the woman beside me. She seems a lot more hairy than I remember… All of a sudden a disconcerting idea enters my mind, terrified I run off as quickly as I can.
Could I have really been so drunk as to lay with a bear?

It has been several months since my little… incident… in the woods, and I have tried my best to forget. But today on the edge of the woods I found a baby, covered in mud and surprisingly hairy for one so young. It looks unmistakably like me… Could this baby be from that night?
I pick up the baby and take it with me.
I will have nothing to do with this.
[Root.GetSonDaughter] of a Bear?

For some time now, you have felt that people talk about you. There are conversations that stop as you enter the room, words spoken in hushed voices behind your back, furtive glances as you walk by. With time, you have managed to deduce certain things… you seem to generally be the subject of either curiosity, fear, envy, or a combination of any of the three.\n\nThe word that you most often hear repeated as you eavesdrop on the gossips is… bear. Indeed, just the other day you heard someone speak a rumor that you’ve heard several times before - that you were born from a bear mother…
Yes, I am a bear! Grrrrr!
These people don't deserve my attention.

For some time now, you have heard people gossiping about your [From.GetSonDaughter] [From.GetFirstName]. There are conversations that stop as you enter the room, words spoken in hushed voices behind your back, furtive glances as you walk by. With time, you have managed to deduce certain things… [From.GetFirstName] seems to generally be the subject of either curiosity, fear, envy, or a combination of any of the three.\n\nThe word that you most often hear repeated as you eavesdrop on the gossips is… bear. Indeed, just the other day you heard someone speak a rumor that you’ve heard several times before - that [From.GetHerHis] 'real' mother was a bear
I'm glad they call my [From.GetSonDaughter] a bear!
I must put a stop to this talk.

column3: As time passes, the years change but other things stay the same. Somehow, you know the blood of a bear runs in your veins. This knowledge strengthens you, though sometimes it makes you wonder who you really are…

column2: My future is still to be forged.
Your [From.GetSonDaughter] [From.GetFirstName] has become an adult. The strangeness, [From.GetHerHis] unusual ursine character, remains however. Perhaps it has even become more pronounced with time…
I hope it shall be a blessing and not a curse.

I have long faced rumours that the blood of bears flows in my veins and I have long had vivid dreams of being some great beast of the forest hunting its prey, now a great bear has emerged from the forest. Strangely docile it seems to be seeking me out, almost as if it recognises me…
I am a skinchanger, and I claim the bear as my second skin!
I am no beast!

I have long pondered whether it was a bear or just a wild woman that I lay with all those years ago. Regardless there is a clear truth in the rumours that my[From.GetSonDaughter] [From.GetFirstName] takes after bears in the way that [From.GetSheHe] behaves. Today a great bear has emerged from the woods and [From.GetFirstName] has claimed the beast as their companion. It follows them everywhere and obeys every command it is given.
Let [From.GetHerHis] enemies tremble.

Though you were not born showing the strength of the First Men, you have always been rather robust, and over the years your natural athleticism has strengthened you to the point where you have become rather brawny.
I have become rather strong.

Since the accident crippled me I have been having such vivid and disturbing dreams. In the last one a Three-Eyed Crow told me that I would never walk again, but that I would learn to fly. I do not know what to make of it.
What do these dreams mean?

Last night I had a dream where I was wearing the skin of a cat, wandering the halls and looking for mice, when I happened accross some shadowy figures speaking in hushed tones. They were oblivious to my presence and I was able to creep close enough to hear their conversation, and I was able to hear some most concerning plans that they were plotting.
Their plot is revealed.

Last night I had a dream where I was wearing the skin of a bat, flying through the courtyard in the dead of night, when I happened accross some shadowy figures speaking in hushed tones. They were oblivious to my presence and I was able to follow them inside andhide in the rafters close enough to hear their conversation, and I was able to hear some most concerning plans that they were plotting.
Their plot is revealed.

Last night I had a dream where I was wearing the skin of a crow, flying through the courtyard in the dead of night, when I happened accross some shadowy figures speaking in hushed tones. They were oblivious to my presence and I was able to follow them inside andhide in the rafters close enough to hear their conversation, and I was able to hear some most concerning plans that they were plotting.
Their plot is revealed.

Last night I had a green dream where I was seeing through the eyes of trees and hearing on the ears of the wind when I saw shadow figures speaking in hushed tones. As the Old Gods gradually revealed to me their faces, I was able to hear some most concerning plans that they were plotting.
Their plot is revealed.

My ancestor King Daeron the Young Dragon was a skilled tactician who whilst little more than a child smashed the armies of the Martells, conquering Dorne, a feat not even Aegon the Conqueror could achieve. Lately I have been reading more and more of his exploits and am becoming intrigued by his pursuit of strategy.
Strategy is fascinating maybe I should study it more…
Interesting as this is, I have more pressing matters to attend to.
My Bloodline has long been associated with faith, piety, and devotion to the Gods. Perhaps I should emphasise my dedication and take a vow of celibacy?
I shall ignore the appetites of the flesh.
Maybe that's going a little too far.
King Baelor was a model of piety and faith, perhaps I should follow in his footsteps and live my life in the fullness of faith?
Piety is the mark of the righteous.
Baelor was blessed, but his mind was addled.
King Baelor was a model of piety and faith and claimed that the Seven spoke to him, and gave him commands. Could these voices... could they truly be the Seven? Do they speak through me too?
Behold I am also blessed!
No, I do not hear the Gods.

Long has it said that those with the Farwynd blood are blessed by the Drowned God, with a connection to the beasts of the sea: I have long had vivid dreams of swimming in the cold deep ocean, now a sea lion has come ashore. Strangely docile it seems to be seeking me out, almost as if it recognises me…
I am a skinchanger, and I claim the sea lion as my second skin!
I am no beast!

Long has it said that those with the Farwynd blood are blessed by the Drowned God, with a connection to the beasts of the sea: I have long had vivid dreams of swimming in the cold deep ocean, now a mighty leviathon has come to swim aside my ship. Strangely docile it seems to be seeking me out, almost as if it recognises me…
I am a skinchanger, and I claim the whale as my second skin!
I am no beast!

Long has it said that those with the Farwynd blood are blessed by the Drowned God, with a connection to the beasts of the sea: I have long had vivid dreams of swimming in the cold deep ocean, now a walrus has come ashore. Strangely docile it seems to be seeking me out, almost as if it recognises me…
I am a skinchanger, and I claim the walrus as my second skin!
I am no beast!

You bear the blood of many a legendary warriors, renowned for their skill in personal combat, and the chance to test yourself in combat has always appealed to you. Do you embrace the calling of your ancestors and become a committed duelist?
Personal combat is in my blood.
Dueling bores me.
Your ancestors have a reputation for formality and honourable behaviour. Perhaps you should strive to embody such noble values in your own life, honouring their example?
Such behaviour is the right way to lead my life.
What a load of rubbish.

When I was growing up my nurse would often tell me that those who bore the Westford blood bore the blood of First Men, sometimes able to wear the skins of beasts, I always thought them childish tales, but today I encountered a large wild dog as I was out riding, it eyes seeming to peer into my very soul. Strangely docile it seems to be seeking me out and followed me all the way back to the stables, almost as if it recognises me…
I am a skinchanger, and I claim the dog as my second skin!
I am no beast!
As of late, you have been feeling generous, doling out your wealth to friends, family, and others in need!
We must help the smallfolk in any way we can!
What am I doing???
You have been feeling increasingly on edge of late, hearing others whisper about you in corners, plotting against you, threatening you and all you hold dear.
Well everyone IS out to get me.

I dreamt I was flying, that a crow came to me and opened my third eye, that I looked deep into the heart of winter, that I saw through the eyes of weirwoods, seeing the past present and future, seeing the very truth that lies beneath the world. When I awoke I knew I was chosen by the Old Gods, that I am a greenseer!

I have been having vivid dreams of late, dreams of the leaf and stone, dreams of what is past and what may yet be to come. Could these dreams have meaning? Could these dreams be messages from the Old Gods themselves?
In my dreams I had a vision of an ancient being, seated on a throne of weirwood, they told me they are a greenseer and here to teach me the secrets of the Old Gods
I will learn from them
I will not trouble myself with this knowledge

After many vivid dreams, pushing my mind into those of beasts and trees, and consuming paste made from weirwood seed, I have at last mastered the knowledge of a true greenseer and my master has passed on their mantle to me. Now, if they wish, they may die in peace.

I have taught the new greenseer many secrets of the truth that lies beneath the world and the ways of the Old Gods, now I have nothing left to teach and they are a fully fledged greenseer. Now if I wish I may finally cast off my failing body and become one with the Old Gods.

I have taught the new greenseer many secrets of the truth that lies beneath the world and the ways of the Old Gods, now I have nothing left to teach and they are a fully fledged greenseer. Now if I wish I may finally cast off my failing body and become one with the Old Gods.

I had taught my student much, however it seems that the Old Gods needed them more than I, and they have died, becoming one with the weirwoods. I must wait for a new student to emerge before I can finally accept my own death.

The Greenseer who taught me the ways of the Old Gods has decided to become one with the trees, leaving his body and weirwood throne behind, I now must take up his mantle and guide the Children of the Forest.

The men of House Manderly have long been known to be rather big boned. Over recent weeks you have noticed that you have perhaps been a bit too eager at the feast hall and it is now starting to show...
Pass me another trencher.
No I must resist!

The men of House Manderly have long been known to be rather big boned. Whilst you have long struggled with your weight, there are some advantages that you have found to your large size - you can put more force into your blows and take more of a beating than many of the others you know and as a result you note that you are rather sturdy.
I have become rather strong.

Those whose blood you bear have achieved many great and mighty deeds, carving their names into history through their achievments. Of late you find yourself reflecting on these grand deeds and your pride in them.
I have become rather proud.
I should stay humble.

The men of House Slynt have long been known to be rather plain-faced. Over recent weeks you have noticed that your face is seeming sullen and out of proportion. Perhaps your Slynt blood is starting to show...
Maybe its just this mirror...
During my training and meditation with the Elder in the forest glade I felt my mind begin to forge a strong new connection with a new animal. In time I came to realise I had acquired a new skin!
Excellent.

I have come to realise that the Gods I once followed were false idols, and that true power rests with the Old Gods of the First Men and Children of the Forest. The Gods of tree and stone, of stream and wind. From this day forward I will worship only them.
I live to serve.
I am titled King Beyond-The-Wall, leader of the free-folk and their mightiest champion.
Let the skalds and elders speak of my name until the end of days.

With the defeat of Prince Garin at the end of the Second Spice War the great kingdom of the Rhoynar was destroyed with its people scattered. I have put an end to that, and the Kingdom of the Rhoynar has been rebuilt.\n\nIn a grand announcement in front of my palace in [From.Capital.GetName], I have declared the kingdom reborn, and that the children of Mother Rhoyne were one again, under the protection of [k_rhoynar.GetName].
Let the songs of the Rhoynar sing of my accomplishments!
I have become King of the Andals and the First Men, Lord of the Seven Kingdoms, and Protector of the Realm. No longer does House Targaryen rule these lands, now all must bow to House Baratheon.
Let the singers and bards speak of my name until the end of days.

I have become King of the Andals and the First Men, Lord of the Seven Kingdoms, and Protector of the Realm. No longer will Westeros be a patchwork of squablling kings, now all will bow to House Targaryen.
Let the singers and bards speak of my name until the end of days.

I am the fifth of my dynasty to tame a dragon, and as a result we have amassed a considerable amount knowledge as to how to do so. No longer do we rely on blind luck to hatch and train dragons, we have refined it to an art, like the Valyrians of old!
I will pass this knowledge on to my kin.
I have achieved victory in many of the greatest tourneys of the age, my fame shall outlive me and the singers shall honour my legacy along with the fabled knights of old!
I am the finest knight of the age!
We have won our war against the Others, pushing them back to the Heart of Winter. Singers shall sing of my deeds as they do of the Last Hero and Azhor Ahai!
Let the singers and bards speak of my name until the end of days!

I have become Lord of the Free Cities and Emperor of the Valyrian Freeehold and Protector of the Realm. No longer will the Free Cities be a patchwork of squablling cities, now all will bow to House Targaryen and Valyria will rise again!
Let the singers and bards speak of my name until the end of days.

House Hornwood are powerful vassals of mine who rule the great Hornwood forest. Sadly Lord Halys died at the Battle of Green Fork, and his heir Daryn was slain in the Battle Whispering Wood whilst defending me. The resulting inheritance of the Hornwood lands is a thorny issue that I must resolve. I could award it to Halys' widow Donella which would please her Manderly kin, or I could grant them to his nephew Beren Tallhart who would take the Hornwood name, pleasing his Tallhart relatives, or I could legitimise Halys' bastard Larence Snow, pleasing his Glover guardians?
I shall let Lady Donella keep the lands.
I shall award the lands to Beren "Hornwood".
I shall award the lands to Larence Snow.
Lady Donella Hornwood has inherited her husband's lands. She is vulnerable, perhaps I could abduct her, force her to marry me and have her make me the heir to the Hornwood?
Seems like a plan.
Too risky...

I led a small band of men and successfully set upon Lady Donella as she was out riding, I captured her, took her back to Hornwood and commanded the guards to lay down their arms, before marrying Donella and imprisoning her. I am now Lord of the Hornwood.
To the Oubliette with her.
Keep her in prison
I led a small band of men and tried to seize Lady Donella as she was out riding, her guards fought back and I was captured, and took me back to Hornwood in chains.
Ok.

As I was out riding I was set upon by a gang of men, my guards overpowered them and captured them. Upon questioning it was revealed that their leader was Ramsay Snow, Bastard of the Dreadfort, who sought to capture me and take my lands for himself.
Keep him imprisoned.
My bastard Ramsay concocted a hairbraned plot to seize Lady Hornwood and take her lands. Now he has got himself captured and imprisoned by Lady Donella.
He should have been content to grind corn.

My bastard Ramsay concocted a hairbraned plot to seize Lady Hornwood and take her lands. By some miracle he suceeded and now holds the Hornwood, but the Manderlys, Tallharts, Glovers and Starks will come for vengeance against him.
Hopefully he pulls it off.
Ramsay Snow, Bastard of the Dreadfort captured Lady Hornwood and forced her to marry him, imprisoning her and making himself Lord of the Hornwood.
This criminal must be brough to heel.

Most curious news - it seems Ramsay Snow, Bastard of the Dreadfort tried to kidnap Lady Donella Hornwood, planning to force her to marry him and make himself Lord of the Hornwood. Luckily her guards thwarted his plans and he is now imprisoned in Hornwood Keep.
The North will be well rid of him.

I am travelling across the wide plains of the Dothraki Sea, when off in the distance I see a might hrakkar, the white lions of the steppe, hunting an antelope. The native Dothraki are known to hunt such beasts, perhaps I should go closer?
I must see it up close.
Better to keep my distance.

I stalk up close to the hrakkar, watching it in awe. Suddenly, the breeze shifts and it stiffens. It has smelt me! The beast turns towards me and begins to snarl, breaking into a run! I only have a moment to react.
I will slay the beast!
I reach out my mind and seek to bend it to my will.
I am a skinchanger, able to wear the skin of another with ease. Perhaps I should seek out others like me with similar gifts, to learn from them how to better use the magics of the Old Gods?
I will seek out other skinchangers.
No I don't see the point.

I may chose to focus my prayers on one part of the Godhead above the others, which aspect should I chose?

We Blackwoods have kept the Old Gods, praying at the great raven filled weirwood that gives our keep its name. A weirwood will live forever if undisturbed, but centuries ago our rivals, the Brackens, poisoned it, leaving it dead and its branches bare. But I have gained an understanding of the mysteries of the world, might be able to coax the dead wood back to life?
It will take much knowledge, but I must try.
I will leave the tree as it is.

Bringing the great weirwood back to life is beyond my current learning, I must both gain a greater understanding of plants and the magics of the Old Gods than I currently possess. I must seek out other famous trees and places where knowledge can be found.
I will seek out this knowledge.
I will also take up an interest in gardening.

Whilst in Highgarden I was able to visit the remaining roots of the Oakenseat, the mighty living throne of the Gardener Kings. The Dornish burnt it long ago, but there are runes carved on the stones around it and I felt a whisper of power within them.

The eyes stared back, there is an intelligence to these trees…

One of the largest settlements in the North, Barrowton has been ruled by House Dustin, descendants of the ancient Barrow Kings, since time imemorial. After the death of Lord Willam Dustin in service of Winterfell, it was decided that his widow, Lady Barbrey, daughter of the Lord of the Rills, would rule Barrowton. Now that she has died it falls to me to decide whether Barrowton should remain under House Ryswell, or whether I should return it to Lord Willam's Dustin cousins who want their ancient lands returned.
I shall let the Ryswells keep Barrowton.
I shall return Barrowton to the Dustins.

I have ascended to the throne of the Golden Empire of YiTi, the first of my bloodline to do so. I am now the heir to the God-On-Earth and must choose how what model my descendants and I shall rule by. There are many paths to choose - I may rule through strength, diplomacy, trade, reform, through my divine status, or through dark sorceries - which shall I choose?
I shall push back the nomads and secure the northen frontier.
The shall protect the east from the reavers of the Shadowlands.
I shall dedicate myself entirely to the empire, sacrificing my manhood.
More.
I shall foster peace the Jogos Nhai, my kin.
I shall draw power from the dark powers of the world.
I shall work to improve conditions for the peasantry.
More.
I shall rely on the imperial bureaucracy, prioritising education.
I shall prioritise trade and peace with other kingdoms and empires.
I shall emphasise my divine status, as heir to the God-on-Earth.
Go Back.

I could choose to dedicate myself and my descendants to the eradication of the Jogos Nhai, settling the plains by force, and slaughtering the zorse riders, man, woman, and child. They would despise me for all time, but the northern frontier would at last know peace.
We will crush the nomads!
On second thoughts...

I could choose to dedicate myself and my descendants to the protection of the eastern frontier, holding the line against the reavers from the Shadowlands, and conquering their territory.They would despise me for all time, but the eastern frontier would at last know peace.
We will turn back the Shadowmen!
On second thoughts...

I could choose to dedicate myself and my descendants to the service of the empire, making a sacred oath before the Gods that whilst Princes we will live like other men, taking wives and concubines and siring heirs, but upon our ascent to the throne we will surrender our manhood, root and stem, to devote ourselves entirely to the empire.
I will dedicate myself to the empire.
On second thoughts...

I am kin to the Jogos Nhai, and know their ways. Though I now rule as God-Emperor of YiTi I must remember my roots. I could seek to dedicate myself and my line to fostering peace between YiTi and the Jogos Nhai, the most ancient of enemies, I may even pursuade some tribes to abandon their nomadic ways and settle in cities, bringing peace to the plains.
I will dedicate myself to uniting YiTi and the Jogos Nhai.
On second thoughts...

I could choose to surround myself with mystics and uncover the secret mysteries and dark powers of the world, using them to secure my position, and that of my descendants for all time. Many would call me an evil sorceror, but is not power worth more than reputation?
I will dedicate myself to uncovering the higher mysteries.
On second thoughts...

I could choose to dedicate myself to improving the lives of the peasantry, undertaking reforms to develop the empire. The nobility would dislike it, but are the peasants not the backbone of this great empire?
I will dedicate myself to reforming this empire for the better.
On second thoughts...

I could choose to draw more fully upon the knowledge of the Imperial Bureaucracy, building new academies, educating myself and my court, and appointing bureaucrats to positions of power. The nobility would dislike it, but is the bureaucracy not the backbone of this great empire?
I will use the bureaucracy to full effect.
On second thoughts...
I could choose to foster trade and cooperation with neighbouring kingdoms, using embassies and diplomaatic gifts to build alliances and treaties that keep the empire safe and prosperous.
I will build ties with our neighbours.
On second thoughts...

As the heir to the God-on-Earth I am more than a man, I am a living god! I could choose use my reign to emphasise my divine status to my subjects, reminding them of the reverence that is due to me and my line?
Let all faithful subjects kneel before this living god!
On second thoughts...

The priests remind me of the oaths my ancestors swore to the Gods: that whilst Princes our house would live like other men, taking wives and concubines and siring heirs, but upon our ascent to the throne we will surrender our manhood, root and stem, to devote ourselves entirely to the empire. Now the time has come for me to sacrifice my manhood and rule as a Eunuch Emperor.
I shall fulfil my duty.
No, no, not today.

It is the sacred and sworn duty of me and my descendants to protect the Golden Empire of YiTi against the raiders and reavers of the Shadowlands. But it has become clear that it is not enough to merely push them back - we must take their lands from them and bring light to the Shadow to at last have peace on the eastern frontier. Where shall we seek to attack?.
I shall conquer lands directly on the border.
I shall conquer land in the depths of the Shadowlands.
I shall strike for Ashaii and its environs.
I will take their colonies from them.
The Shadowlands directly bordering of the Golden Empire are home to many savage raiders who prey on the people of the Golden Empire, they must be punished and brought to heel. Where shall I start?
I shall lay claim to Saraburai on the coast.
I shall lay claim to the Shadow Mountains.
Actually I shall choose another target.

The lands at the heart of the Shadow, along the banks of the River Ash are home to many savage raiders who prey on the people of the Golden Empire, they must be punished and brought to heel. Where shall I start?
I shall claim Taegye, in the foothills of the Mountains of Morn.
I shall claim Manpos, on the banks of the River Ash.
I shall claim Kumirai, in the heart of the Shadow.
Actually I shall choose another target.
In order to fully bring the Shadowlanders to heel we must subdue Asshai-by-the-Shadow, the dark city of sorcerors, and its surrounding lands. Where shall I start?
I shall lay claim to Asshai itself.
I shall lay claim to Chaiysa, on the Jade Sea.
I shall lay claim to the Saffron Lands.
Actually I shall choose another target.

Bold men have begun to colonise the many ruins that dot the Shadowlands. Left unchecked these too will become home to raiders who seek nothing more than to bring ruin to the Golden Empire. I must ride out and conquer these lands. Where shall I start?
I shall lay claim to Stygai, the recently colonised Corpse City.
I shall lay claim to the Saffron Isle, in the Saffron Straits.
I shall lay claim to the Isle of Ulos, in the Saffron Straits.
Actually I shall choose another target.

As the Captain-General of the Golden Company, Harry Strickland has done much to secure my throne for me. It is only right I consider his claim first. He lays claim to the former High Lordship of the Bite, now held by House Saul, and the associated Lordship of Scorched Vale.
Arise Lord Harrold of the Bite!
These lands are outside my control, but I will do all I can to grant them to you.
I must keep the peace, I will find him another title.

House Toyne are an ancient House from the Stormlands. They fell from grace after the brothers of Ser Terrence Toyne sought vengeance for his death, killing the Dragonknight in the process. As leal members of the Golden Company they claim their ancient Lordship of Summerfield, now ruined.
Take this coin and begin rebuilding, Lord Toyne of Summerfield!
These lands are outside my control, but I will do all I can to grant them to you.
I must keep the peace, I will them another title.

Arise Lord Strong of the Red Fork!
These lands are outside my control, but I will do all I can to grant them to you.

These lands are outside my control, but I will do all I can to grant them to you.

House Fossoway trace their descent back to Garth Greenhand and have two landed branches, the Red Apples and the Green Apples. Perhaps a castle should be taken from the Red Apple Fossoways for him?
Arise Ser Franklyn of the Brown Apple Fossoways, Knight of Dunstonbury!
These lands are outside my control, but I will do all I can to grant them to you.
I must keep the peace, I will find him another title.

House Cole were once stewards to House Dondarrion but fell from grace thanks to the actions of Lord Commander Criston Cole, the Kingmaker, in the Dance of Dragons. An exiled branch of the House served ably in the Golden Company, perhaps I could return the Castle of Bonewatch to them?
Arise Ser of Bonewatch!
These lands are outside my control, but I will do all I can to grant them to you.

Arise Lord Marq of the Blue Fork!
These lands are outside my control, but I will do all I can to grant them to you.

I will return the High Lordship to the Peakes and grant them two new castles!
These lands are outside my control, but I will do all I can to grant them to you.
I must keep the peace, I will find him another title.

Take this coin and begin rebuilding, Lord Mudd of Oldstones!
These lands are outside my control, but I will do all I can to grant them to you.

Arise Lord Harys of Tarbeck Hall!
These lands are outside my control, but I will do all I can to grant them to you.

Arise Ser Glendon, Knight of Firemeadow!
These lands are outside my control, but I will do all I can to grant them to you.
I must keep the peace, I will find him another title.

A bastard branch of the House, descended from Ser Robb Reyne, the great champion of Daemon Blackfyre, calling themselves the Rainhills, survived and served in the Golden Company. Perhaps I could grant them Castamere?
Arise Lord Malcolm of Castamere!
These lands are outside my control, but I will do all I can to grant them to you.

I am a descendant of House Reyne, an ancient house descended from the First Men, that looms large in the history of the Westerlands. Now that House Reyne is extinct and I hold the ancient Castle of Castamere, perhaps we Rainhills should adopt the name of our Reyne forbears?
Yes, I shall take the Reyne name.
No, I shall retain our Rainhill name.

Yes, I shall take the Ball name.
No, I shall retain Fireball name.

Aegon, son of Rhaegar, has ascended the Iron Throne with the help of the Golden Company, a band of exiles and sellswords. In recompense he is now hearing the claims the various members of the company hold to Westerosi titles, with a mind to returning them to his loyal supporters.
Let us hope none of them put forward a claim to any of my titles.

House Strickland were dispossessed of their lands in the Vale in the wake of the Blackfyre Rebellion and my ancestors were granted them for our loyalty. Stricklands have been serving in the Golden Company ever since. Now it seems Captain-General Harry Strickland seeks to claim my title which was taken from his ancestors decades ago!
A thousand curses upon House Strickland!

Stricklands have been serving in the Golden Company ever since. Now it seems Captain-General Harry Strickland seeks to claim the Lordship of Scorched Vale and the High Lordship of the Bite, titles held by my vassals.
We shall watch these events closely.

I pray that King Aegon remembers his friends

It seems the ever rebellious Peakes have, at last, managed to turn a situation to their advantage, it seems the Peakes who served in the Golden Company are petitioning King Aegon for the return of the High Lordship of Cockleswent and for two new castles to replace those lost in their rebellions.

With the offspring of Cersei Lannister having been revealed as bastards born of foul incest with her brother, the line of House Baratheon seemed threatened. Today, as you were going about on your business a stranger stopped you and asked you many questions about your birth, at the end of which he revealed he believed you are a bastard child of King Robert!
My father is Robert Baratheon??

Interesting news from [From.Location.GetName], [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFOA], it seems a bastard bearing a striking resemblance to King Robert Baratheon calling [From.GetHerselfHimself] [From.GetFirstName] has been uncovered and declared a child of Robert's and has chosen the name [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] for their cadet dynasty.
I doubt this is the last royal bastard out there...

Your men bring you news from [From.Location.GetName] of an individual with a striking resemblance to Robert Baratheon. Upon further questioning about their birth you are certain, this is a child of Robert's! You tell [From.GetFirstName] to choose a sigil for themselves and tell your maester to send ravens to all the lords of the realm declaring the existence of this new claimant to the throne.
I doubt this is the last royal bastard out there.

A group of guardsmen accost you on the street and take you to a darkened room where hooded figure is wreathed in shadow. They proceed to ask you all manner of questions about your birth and your mother. Then they order the guards to bring you closer, inspecting your face directly.
What is going on?

As you go about your business in [Root.Location.GetName] you see an individual who bears a shocking relationship to Robert Baratheon! You order your guards to accost them and bring them to you in the back room of a nearby tavern. Upon questioning them and inspecting them they are clearly one of Robert's bastards!
Take them away and kill them!
We will have no bloodshed today - release them.

Now that you are victorious and the true parentage of the Lannisters is now known to all, House Baratheon teeters on the brink of extinction. Nevertheless King Robert left many bastards, and the identities of a number of them are known to your spymaster - perhaps you should acknowledge them and let them carry on the Baratheon name?
Let the Bastards be acknowledged.
No, I will not acknowledge them.

With Cersei revealed as an incestuous adultress I really should consider who shall carry on my line. I have fathered many bastards over the years. Of course there is sweet Mya, fathered when I was a lad, and likely many others. My spymaster knows of several although it is likely not the full list. Perhaps I should acknowledge them to continue my legacy?
Let the Bastards be acknowledged.
No, I will not acknowledge them.
A few minutes later the guards return with a bloody blade and a small sack: "The bastard is dead Your Grace" they tell you. They open the sack to reveal the bastard's decapitated head.
Not a word of this to anyone, am I clear?

A few minutes later the guards return with a bloody blade: "The bastard is dead Your Grace" they tell you. They tell you they threw the body into the lake and show you a bloody lock of coal brown hair as proof.
Not a word of this to anyone, am I clear?

The guardsmen take you to a secluded alley, far from anyone who would help and tell you to kneel as they bind your hands. You look up at them in terror. One of them leans down and whispers in your ear "A Lannister always pays their debts" as they plunge a knife into your chest.
No! Mercy! Please!

The guardsmen take you to a secluded alley, far from anyone who would help and tell you to kneel as they bind your hands. Then they look at one another as one says "we never agreed to be butchers." He strides over to you with a knife as you cower in fear, and he cuts a lock of your hair and slashes your hand smearing the hair with blood. Then he unbinds you and bids you run, far from this place and never return.
I run and never look back.

The hooded figure speaks to the guardsmen who nod with a look of surprise. They take you back outside and tell you to go back about your business, giving you a kick as you stumble out into the daylight.
What in the Seven Hells was that about??

I am a descendant of Robert Baratheon, and though my ancestry is tainted by bastardry I have now risen to hold the titles he once held. Perhaps I should now legitimise myself as a full member of House Baratheon?
I am a true Baratheon.
No, I will keep my current house.
The Basilisk of Gogossos

The Isle of Tears was once the site of a great city founded by the Ghiscari and captured by the Valyrian Freehold during the Third Ghiscari War who renamed it Gogossos. The dragonlords used it as a penal colony for the worst criminals. New methods of torture were used and blood magic is said to have been practiced on the Isle. Gogossos grew powerful through slavery and sorcery during the Century of Blood, with some calling it the "Tenth Free City", until the Red Death brought ruin to the Basilisk Islands.\nNow only ruins remain as you begin your reconstruction. Beneath an ancient temple to the Valyrian Gods your builders have found a strange room carved in Valyrian glyphs and with a life sized stone basilisk with a gaping open mouth in the centre. One who speaks Old High Valyrian tells you they speak of a sacrificial ritual and a great reward for those who will grant the basilisk the blood it craves...
I will do what I must, have one of the [Root.GetPeasantNamePlural] bound and brought here.
I know enough sorcery to break these bindings without bloodshed
Leave it be, let the horrors of Old Gogossos rest

The prisoner is place with their head in the mouth of the stone basilisk as the glyphs instruct, suddenly the jaws slam shut, removing the man's head in a single stroke. As his blood drains from his body a section of wall lifts up revealing a secret room full of treasures, and, greatest of all a Valyrian Steel blade!

You puzzle over the glyphs, it seems this was a sacrificial chamber used by the Gogossans to conduct their cruel flesh-changing rituals. After several hours you feel ready to circumvent the spells and with great exertion you bind the powers of this place to yourself. As you do a section of wall lifts up revealing a secret room full of treasures, and, greatest of all a Valyrian Steel blade!
The Chimera of Valyria

The City of Monsters Mantarys at the northern tip of the Sea of Sighs was one of the many cities founded by the ancient Valyrian Freehold, and its deformed inhabitants remember more of Valyria than most.\nNow that you have reunited the Lands of Valyria once more a group of twisted Mantyran priests come to you, acclaiming you as true heir to the Freehold. They bring you an ancient Valyrian Steel greatsword that they have held as a sacred relic since before the Doom and offer to teach you the secrets of their order.
I am the true heir of Valyria!
The Sphinx of the Woods

The Dothraki call the forests south of the Shivering Sea the Kingdom of the Ifequevron, telling legends of diminuitive woods walkers, a small, shy and gentle folk. Now that the forests are being settled once more a strange group of these Ifquevron have come to your court asking for an audience with you. The creatures speak your tongue with a strange, alien accent and offer you a bargain, if you will pledge them gifts of leaf, stone, and water, and make your subjects honour the forests and sacred trees signing a pact for yourself and your successors, they will teach you ancient secrets and give you mighty gifts they obtained from ancient men who "rode upon the very sky itself".
I will accept their teachings.
Begone you foul demons!
The Crown and the Sword

[From.GetName] was once the site of a great castle, overlooking the Narrow Sea. In Kin of the Stag Maester Hubert claims that it was built by Andals and was the seat of petty kings who were eventually brought to heal by the Storm Kings. Almost all of the castle was in ruins when you started the rebuilding, piles of fallen stone everywhere and overgrown with ivy. One day whilst clearing some rubble your builders found a passageway leading below ground to a set of catacombs with grand tombs and carved sephulchres of the ancient kings, and within them many chests filled with ancient gold and coins! They have even found what must be the Royal crown, and, lying on a the tomb engraved with the image of a mighty knight, a strange sword with a pale blade, amazingly sharp, unblemished by the centuries. The workers whisper that it is Just Maid, the blade of Ser Galladon of Morne!
I shall take them for my own to strengthen my rule.
Leave it be, they should remain with Ser Galladon.
Your martial prowess is becoming something of note, and people in both [Root.Capital.GetName] and beyond acknowledge it, speaking with admiration of "the Bastard of [Root.Capital.GetName].".
I will bring honour to myself and my house.

column2: Inspired by the example of your bold ancestors, many of whom were women like you, you have been throwing yourself into training in the yard, using bow, sword, and lance. Gradually you are learning more and more and are gaining an understanding the principles of combat. The guards joke that you will become a true warrior woman, like those in the songs the bards sing!
I will show them!

Over the last few weeks my [From.GetRootRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstName] has been expressing an unusual interest in fighting. Where once [From.GetSheHe] had no interest in arms, now [From.GetSheHe] is spending more time in the practice yard training. In the process [From.GetSheHe] has gained an understanding of the basic principles of comabat. When I asked [From.GetHerHim] why, [From.GetSheHe] said [From.GetSheHe] was inspired by the martial women [From.GetSheHe] was descended from!
Good for [From.GetHerHim]!
As a member of the Kingsguard, you are entitled to a beautifully wrought suit of enamelled plate to protect you whilst you shield the Throne.
This is an exceptional piece of work!

As Hand of the King to the Iron Throne, you are entitled to a beautifully wrought badge of office to symbolise your authority. The badge of the hand marks you out as the right hand of the ruler, and you speak with their voice, but the stress of the role may be bad for your health.
This is an exceptional piece of work!
Hire a Bard
Your court currently lacks a bard. Perhaps you should make enquiries to see if there are any willing to join you?

Having a court bard is a mark of distinction and refinement, by hiring one your prestige and reputation will grow. However, you must decide what type of bard you want to employ and how much you want to spend to hire them.
Just send the guards to the tavern and bring back the first drunk to hold a tune!
Find me a local singer who is reasonably competent.
Find me a genuinely talented singer.
Send men to the ends of the earth if you must!

A few hours later the guards drag a rather drunk and confused peasant before you. "My [Root.GetLordLady], we found this man in the tavern, he seems to be able to hold a tune." Blinking the peasant starts to stammer. Reaching down you pull a lute out of a chest and hand it to him. "Congratulations," you say "you're now the court bard of [Root.Capital.GetName]"
The peasant blinks, then mummbles "Thank you m'lud"

A few days later your steward informs you that they have found a talented minstrel, known throughout the area. They have wandered from keep to keep and feast to feast over the last few years, but are now looking for more settled employment. The bard agrees to serve you for the forseeable future. "Congratulations," you say "you're now the court bard of [Root.Capital.GetName]"
The bard bows low, takes out their lute, and begins to strum.

A few days later your steward informs you that they have found a talented minstrel, known far and wide, having sung throughout the Seven Kingdoms who now seeks to settle down. The bard is introduced to you and agrees to serve you for the forseeable future. "Congratulations," you say "you're now the court bard of [Root.Capital.GetName]"
The bard bows low with a flourish, takes out their lute, and begins to strum.

A weeks days later, after dispatching men to the furthest ends of the kingdoms and even across the Narrow Sea your steward informs you that they have found a talented minstrel, known far and wide, a true legend, with a voice like a songbird. The bard is introduced to you and agrees to serve you for the forseeable future.
Congratulations, you say "you're now the court bard of [Root.Capital.GetName]"
Buy a Lute
Purchase a well decorated lute to play?
This is folly and madness, I will not betray the Starks!
Theon Turncloak

News from [From.Capital.GetName] [Root.GetTitledFirstName], it seems that after being forced to choose between his true family and his foster family Prince Theon Greyjoy of the Iron Isles has chosen to betray his House. It seems that after being ordered by his father, Iron King Balon Greyjoy, to harry the Stony Shore Theon decided to defect. Feigning loyalty to his father he sailed his longship North, before deliberately leading his own men into a Northman ambush. Some of his crew, including his squire Wex Pyke, chose to defect to King Robb Stark, the rest were executed. Now that you hold the Stormlands in the Kings name after defeating the last Storm King Argilac, you have taken Argella, his only daughter and heir, as your wife. To honor Argliac's valor, you took the stag banner, honors and words of the Durrandons. But many still consider you a foreigner, and the lords of the Stormlands will never consider you their true ruler unless you become one of them and leave behind your valyrian heritage...
I will take my wife's culture as well
A Cursed Reward

Harren and his line have been expelled from their once mighty castle. The castle is too big to garrison effectively and too expensive to maintain, many believe it to be cursed and haunted due to the mixed human blood Harren the Black used for the stonework. Whatever the truth is, you know you must choose a new lord to prevent the castle from turning into a fortress for bandits and enemies of the realm. Ser Quenton has been your Master-at-Arms at Dragonstone for several years, he has two strong sons and is fiercely loyal to you. He is perhaps the only one willing to maintain Harrenhal if his King commanded it...
Quenton and his line shall rule Harrenhal
No, Harrenhal is doomed, this is no reward
The River Lord

After your victory over Harren the Black, the lords of the riverlands pledged themselves to you. Edmyn Tully, the Lord of Riverrun, was the first among them to join you against King Harren instead of joining him in the defense of Harrenhal. Many lords of the Trident followed him to your side. After Harrenhal was conquered, Edmyn made a public oath of fealty to House Targaryen. The lands of the Triden have been under control of many foreigner kings in the last centuries. Until now, no lord had been able to gather the loyalty and strenght needed to rule above the rest, but now that Westeros is united under one King, and the lands of the Trident can know peace and independence, perhaps its time for one of their own to rule them in your name...
Edmyn Tully shall be known as the first Lord Paramount of the Trident
No, i shall choose someone else
The Kraken Lord

King Harren the Black ruled all lands from the Neck to the Blackwater Rush. After you defeated him, the Riverlands and the Iron Islands lost their King and became independent once again. The ironborn are a stubborn and proud people, and you felt the need to quickly proclaim a proper Lord Paramount to keep them at bay. You allowed them to revive their ancient custom and they chosed Lord Vickon Greyjoy of Pyke to have the primacy among them. Its up to you as King to confirm this election and name House Greyjoy as rulers of the Iron Islands...
I will respect their custom
No, i shall choose someone else
The Vulture King

The Red Mountains extend over much of southern Westeros and divides Dorne in the South from the Stormlands and the Reach to the North. Now there are rumors of an outlaw called "Vulture King" that claims the mountains as his. This so called "king" has gathered an army of outlaws to attack the Andals to the north, he hides in the mountains after every attack, and the Marcher Lords are unable to face him in the field.
Who is this so called "King"?

The outlaw known as "Vulture King" is now a threat too great to ignore. He has gathered thousands of men and your vassals are unable to face him to put and end to his twisted reign. Now, in his madness, the Vulture King of the Red Mountains has declared war to all of Dorne enemies. Should he be allowed to act with impunity for much longer, he will cause chaos along the border.
This Vulture is no "King", but an outlaw and a traitor ready to be hunted

You have heard the news of someone called "Vulture King" in the red mountains. He has declared war on the realms to the north, and this has caused a diplomatic problem with those lords. You are demanded to do something about this outlaw, but no foreigner should be able to force the hand of a Prince of Dorne...
Dorne will aid you against this outlaw
I will do everything i can to put the rebellion down...
Actually, i like this "Vulture King"
A Vulture Lair

You are exploring near the red mountains when someone claims to have found something interesting. As you approach, you realize many soldiers lived in this place once, as many old weapons and even corpses lie forgotten near the entrance of a dark cave. As you bravely go through the place, you found more and more evidences of the military importance this place had for someone in the past. Finally, in what appears to be the final "room" of this place, you found more weapons, old clothes, and what matters the most, gold. Someone should have hidden it inside this cave many years ago, and everyone who knew of his existance must be dead, or they would have returned already to reclaim this wealth. Now they belong to you, but you cant help but wonder: who owned this hidden lair, and what happened to him?
Perhaps this is a lair of the Vulture King...

Following your last victory more and more men have flocked to the banner of the Vulture King, drawn by hopes of gold and glory. You have spent some time laying low and marshalling your strength, but now it is time to strike out once more, and raid across the lands to the north, making all fear the Vulture King.
We shall raid across the Marches once more
The Recruitment Tour

For thousands of years the Watch have defended the Wall and the realms of men. But the Watch needs men and wealth to survive against what lies to the North. With time, less and less noble men and good fighters decide to join the Watch on their own, and the Watch has been forced to rely on murderers, rapists and whatever kind of criminal the lords of the South have sent them for them to die in the Wall instead of their prisons. It is now a custom for the Watch to send a wandering crow to several lords and castles seeking for these kind of recruits, and its been quite sometime since the last one...
The Watch always need more gold and men...
No, I will not ask for those lords pity
The Recruiter of the Watch

A recruiter from the Nights Watch arrives at your castle asking for some help. The Watch is in need of good men and gold to survive another winter. Perhaps its a good chance to get rid of your prisoners, or even join the Watch yourself...
I can lend some gold for the Watch
The Watch is always welcome here, take any prisoner in the cells
I will take the vows myself, it is time for my son to rule
Get out of here, I have no time for the Watch
Recruitment in the South
The Recruiter has ended his tour among the Northern Houses and now sends a raven to now wether he should return or go south for more recruits...
Try in the Riverlands and the Vale
I need every men we can get now, get back immediately

Take some prisoners from the cells
My time has come, I will leave with you
Why should a Wall so far away concern me?
Tour in the Stormlands

The Watch still has friends in those lands

There are many riches in those lands

I hope we find good dornish men...

He better survive for the sake of the Watch...

As a beautiful daughter of a lord you have always gotten what you desired. It seems a pretty lowborn man has set his eyes on you, he is no fit to lay with someone like you, but your lust is starting to get the better of you...
I can do whatever I want, and no one will know...
